intro: Senecio evelynae, commonly known as Evelyn's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Namibia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, succulent-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Senecio evelynae is considered a rare and endangered species.
